static int counter = 0
 static counter that counts the number of DPM objects running in the program
static int ** dp2s
 static list of dimension [n_dp][3] that takes in a dp index i and returns three sp indices: a = dp2s[i][0], b = dp2s[i][1] and c = dp2s[i][2]
static int *** s2dp
 static list of dimension [M][M][M] that takes three sp indices a,b and c and returns a dp index i: i = s2dp[a][b][c]

ostream & operator<< (ostream &output, DPM &dpm_p)

Detailed Description

Author:
Brecht Verstichel
Date:
23-02-2010

This class, DPM, is a class written for three-particle matrices (name comes from drie-particle matrix). It is written specially for the T_1 condition. It inherits all the functions from its mother class Matrix, some special member functions and two lists that give the relationship between the dp (three-particle) and the sp basis.

Definition at line 17 of file DPM.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DPM::DPM ( int  M,
int  N 
)

standard constructor: constructs Matrix object of dimension M*(M - 1)*(M - 2)/6 and if counter == 0, allocates and constructs the lists containing the relationship between sp and dp basis.

Parameters:
M nr of sp orbitals
N nr of particles

Definition at line 21 of file DPM.cpp.

DPM::DPM ( DPM &  dpm_c  ) 

copy constructor: constructs Matrix object of dimension M*(M - 1)*(M - 2)/6 and copies the content of dpm_c into it, if counter == 0, allocates and constructs the lists containing the relationship between sp and dp basis.

Parameters:
dpm_c input DPM to be copied

Definition at line 75 of file DPM.cpp.

DPM::~DPM (  )  [virtual]

destructor: if counter == 1 the memory for the static lists dp2s en s2dp twill be deleted.

void Matrix::diagonalize ( double *  eigenvalues  )  [inherited]

Diagonalizes symmetric matrices. Watch out! The current matrix (*this) is destroyed, in it the eigenvectors will be stored (one in every column).

Parameters:
eigenvalues the pointer of doubles in which the eigenvalues will be storen, Watch out, its memory has to be allocated on the dimension of the matrix before you call the function.

void Matrix::L_map ( Matrix &  map,
Matrix &  object 
) [inherited]

Multiply symmetric matrix object left en right with symmetric matrix map to form another symmetric matrix and put it in (*this): this = map*object*map

Parameters:

Definition at line 159 of file Matrix.cpp.

double DPM::operator() ( int  a,
int  b,
int  c,
int  d,
int  e,
int  z 
) const

access the elements of the matrix in sp mode, antisymmetry is automatically accounted for:

DPM(a,b,c,d,e,f) = -TPM(b,a,c,d,e,f) = ...

DPM(a,a,c,d,e,f) = 0

Parameters:
a first sp index that forms the dp row index i together with b and c
b second sp index that forms the dp row index i together with a and c
c third sp index that forms the dp row index i together with a and b
d first sp index that forms the dp column index j together with e and z
e second sp index that forms the dp column index j together with d and z
z third sp index that forms the dp column index j together with d and e
Returns:
the number on place DPM(i,j) with the right phase.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

ostream& operator<< ( ostream &  output,
DPM &  dpm_p 
) [friend]

Output stream operator overloaded, the usage is simple, if you want to print to a file, make an ifstream object and type:

object << dpm_p << endl;

For output onto the screen type:

cout << dpm_p << endl;

Parameters:
output The stream to which you are writing (e.g. cout)
dpm_p the DPM you want to print

Reimplemented from Matrix.
